intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. abortiva, commonly known as the desert flax or sand flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is well adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils.
